alert.note: Alert for Nicholas; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:57AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River at Blue Licks Spring affecting Nicholas and Robertson Counties. .Heavy rain from earlier this week has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River at Blue Licks Spring. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, cropland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 26.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Saturday was 27.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at 26.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 06/18/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by midday Sunday.
